channel.title: Compilers always lie
channel.description:
Alright well I added a bunch of commands I like from my old server onto a new source (extremely simple things, mostly just addItem commands) and once I compiled I had 0 errors with the commands I put in, but now it's saying there's a problem with "public void debug(String text)"
The error is
'client.java:8414: Illegal start of expression public void debug(String text) { ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
Any ideas?

item.title: Compilers always lie
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

Jordiescape:

Wow, you’ve added a lot of unneeded brackets. Show me line 8464 and above+below.

line 8464 is the line directly above

[code]public void debug(String text) {
if (debug)
sM(text);

[/code]

that’s why it didn’t make sense to me

Read full topic

item.title: Compilers always lie
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Wow, you’ve added a lot of unneeded brackets. Show me line 8464 and above+below.

item.title: Compilers always lie
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

That coding isn’t even your problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Compilers always lie
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:6, topic:300114”][quote author=k0 twin link=topic=396395.msg2944124#msg2944124 date=1252107327]
This is what’s above

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }
[/quote]
Is your problem. Remove the bottom ‘}’ = fixed.[/quote]

I did, and it gives me the same error, except when it was first “client.java:8414” It’s now “client.java: 8464”

Read full topic

item.title: Compilers always lie
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:3, topic:300114”]This is what’s above

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } } [/quote]
Is your problem. Remove the bottom ‘}’ = fixed.

item.title: Compilers always lie

item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

This is what’s above

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

This is what’s stated as incorrect or whatev.

public void debug(String text) { if (debug) sM(text); }

And this is what’s below

public void declineTrade() { declineTrade(true); }
